Name: DP1066
Title: An impressive Hall!
Review: Located in the second courtyard of the Amber Fort, the Hall of Public Audience has two rows of columns each topped by a elephant-shaped capital.  This is where the Maharaja used to address his subjects.

Name: SalimM
Title: Public hall
Review: Diwan-e-Aam or Hall of public audience is a large hall. There are two rows of pillars supporting the structure. The top of these columns have elephant shaped structure and galleries with lattice work. The hall is open on three sides. The king used to sit in the hall and listen to the queries of common men. This hall is famous for its mosaic glass works.

Name: Memoirs-Sachin
Title: Hall for the citizens of the state
Review: The Diwan-e-Aam Hall of Public Audience is a section in the Amber Fort where the King would address the public. It is a huge courtyard providing panoramic view of the village downhill.

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: Nice place.
Review: This place is a major attraction and acts a hall for groups of people. This place has  historic meaning.

Name: Prathamesh Sawant
Title: Hall for the subjects!!
Review: The counterpart to Diwan-e-Khaas, this is the hall where the royals would meet the subjects and listen to their queries/complaints.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: You experience Royal giving audiences to the common citizens
Review: This is the place where Maharaja of Jaipur heard common citizens grievances and redressed them. On the walls you will see impressive paintings of all the Maharajas. You must go see for your convenience.Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: City palace
Review: This is one of the major attractions of the city palace of jaipur. Located at the heart of city. This hall was used for public meetings.

Name: Umang A
Title: Royal hall
Review: This hall located in city palace was dedicated for public meetings during dynasty rule in Jaipur ....

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: City palace...
Review: This one is also located inside the royal city palace... This hall was used to conduct public meetings... Life sized paintings of rulers are displayed here.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Beautiful hall inside City Palace
Review: During my vacation in Jaipur, I had visited the beautiful City Palace complex and this marble floored courtyard called Diwan-e-Aam is located between the armory and the art gallery within the complex. This was the hall of public audience where king used to hear grievances of common people. We saw here 2 giant sterling silver vessels which holds Guinness World record as world's largest sterling silver vessels. One can also see beautiful crystal chandeliers hanging from the ceiling.Entrance ticket for City Palace is priced at 130 Rupees for Indians and 500 Rupees for foreigners and also there is a special ticket of 2500 Rupees which gives special access to private rooms in the Chandra Mahal with a personal guide.

Name: Jaroslaw Kaczmarski
Title: Where the old meets temporary
Review: Go there if you want to see how these all old building were furnished and set up. This is a very unique place, where you can see it. Very recommended.

Name: ashrafazrol
Title: At the center of the city palace
Review: This place provides historical understanding of the royal Jaipur kingship. I has multitudes of impressive architecture and decoration. There are also exhibition of historical royal artifacts, attire, and garments. Weapons are also on display. There are many corners of the palace worthy of Insta-pictures.

Name: Umang A
Title: Royal...
Review: The city palace gives you glipms of royal era of Rajsthani/ erthwhile Rajlutana.. hire a guide to learn about many old facinating stories...

Name: Smrutirekha
Title: Part of the City Palace
Review: The name defines the place. One can see the canons standing with pride and elegance and the antiques are worth a picture to be clicked with. This is part of the City Palace tour. There is a large vessel made of Brass which is worth a click. In the old times this was used to fetch water water from the Ganges for the Palace. Its a good place overall.

Name: Ricardo B
Title: One of the features of the palace
Review: The Jaipur city palace is pretty magnificent and this is one of the nicest features. In the style of the Mughal public audience building, one of the highlights is the huge silver jars in the main entrace

Name: Manish Sarraf
Title: Site included in City palace tour
Review: The place is in mid of palace having big silver jars, old guns decorated in sun pattern. Nice to get clicked with antique items.

Name: Sweta P
Title: Royal at its Best
Review: Lots and lots of stories are there for this place, the name itself feels Royal and things also feels the touch of Royal, great to visit.

Name: Prabal G
Title: Beautiful and airy
Review: Two big silver vessels make it stand apart. Beautiful arches and pillars inside it. This is the place where the king would meet general public and sort out their matters.

Name: MAYANKBIGDELHIFOODIE
Title: loved it
Review: this muesum is worth going loved itwe can see our cultureold era of kings queenhow they used 2 dressplayfightlive old era

Name: TravellingSands
Title: World's largest Silver Vessels on Display
Review: This artistic hall of public audience is an airy building with numerous arches and a mosaic flooring. The highlights of this hall are the two huge silver urns which the Kin used to transport the Holy water of River Ganges on his trip to England.

Name: jonahNJ
Title: Home of the enormous silver urns
Review: This Hall of Public Audience is similar to other Halls I visited while traveling through northern India. There were the ornate pillars that the ornate arches. However, in this Diwan e Aam, there were two large silver urns which are reportedly the largest of their kind in the world. There were also displays of swords. However, a special treat I had was watching a man demonstrate how turbans are wrapped as headwear. I was surprised to learn that the cloths used for turbans can be as long as 7-9 yards. This was the highlight of my brief visit to this Diwan e Aam.

Name: Moiz H
Title: Meeting place
Review: Diwane e aam is a meeting place for common people, in old days rulers hear common peoples cases here.

Name: cg2792
Title: Lovely area of the city palace
Review: Really lovely and relaxing area to walk around in the city palace. Few indoor exhibits available too which I wish they would have allowed photography inside as postcards do not do it justice!

Name: karthikeya r
Title: Special meeting place of the kings
Review: Diwan-e-Aam was a meeting place for special people from the king's court. Important meetings were organized here in the olden days.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The mesmerizing royal court of audience for general meetings !
Review: Any one coming to jaipur generally comes to Amer Fort and this place is the first which comes in the view ! It leaves one spell bound by its history and the architectural Beaty . The work on the round shaped pillars and the huge hall is open on all sides with beautiful work on the ceiling ! A true reflection of the bygone era . The Mughal influence is very visible here . The entry fee for the Fort visit is heavy but , it is different pricing for Indians / non Indians visitors . The visit to the from here forts starts here . Would advise to have an experienced guide approved by the govt .

Name: VIPIN_GOEL_TP_Impex
Title: Meeting place for common people with the Rulers
Review: Rulers of Jaipur State listen to the grievances of common people here in the City Palace. The concept name 'Diwan-e-Aam' is originated from Mughals.

Name: Satyendra Garg
Title: Diwan-e-Aam used to be place where meetings with common people were held. It is there at Red Fort, Amber and City Palace
Review: As distinguished from Diwan-e-Khas which was for the special people Diwan-e-AAm was for the common people. The Royalty used to meet common man at this place. You find this at Red Fort and so also at Amber Fort. The Rajputs of Jaipur drew their inspiration from the Mughals and named their important establishments on Mughal pattern. At Amber you find beautiful Diwan-e-Aam and so also at City Palace which was also called Sabha Grih. At city palace there are two massive elegant single stone elephants at the entrance of Diwan-e-Aam and at Amber the Diwan-e-Aam is on beautiful sandstone pillars. Diwan-e-Aam were the places of public festival celebrations and public meetings.Spend sometime to understand the nuances of places where common meetings and important meeting were held. Visit to these places is to familiarise with Mughal art and culture which was adopted by those Rajputs who aligned with them.

Name: Arghya Das
Title: Diwan-e-Aam (Hall of Public Audience) – A historical place in City Palace of Jaipur
Review: Diwan-e-Aam (Hall of Public Audience) was the place where the Maharajas of Jaipur used to hear and decide the grievances of his people.  It is also called “Sabha Niwas”. This audience hall is famous for its beautifully ornamented flowery ceilings and the two large elephants at the entrance which are made with a single marble rock.

Name: Gavin R
Title: Within the city palace
Review: If you visit the City palace of Jaipur you can visit, this place too, Its nice, its historic, and thats about it. If your sent quite into history you can skip it and just see the rest of the palace.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: City palace
Review: Diwan -e- Aam hall is also city palace part.this hall is very beautiful.must see this.its architecture is nice.

Name: Alok Kumar A
Title: Waste of Time and Money
Review: Not worth to go such a distance just to see a very small section of History. Indian tourist are not allowed in most of the City palace area.

Name: princ512
Title: Interesting place
Review: This place was a meeting area for general public, all issues of public were addressed here by the wajir. One can only imagine how the proceedings were used to happen at this place. It is the first main hall, when you enter the paid area of Amber Fort.

Name: Suzzanna2014
Title: A walk to the ancient life
Review: The place is pretty good as it takes you to the lifestyle of the royal family. There is a full collection of armoury, ancient clothing and pictures. There is also the dining room, kitchen setup (with real utensils that were used then) and a place with puppet show (must watch and pay him good money- he does a good job but hardly gets money). It's a an amazing place altogether.

Name: Prabhs13
Title: Main attraction of City Palace Hall
Review: The main usp of visiting City Palace is Diwan-e-aam Hall. Various portrays of kings has been placed and well preserved to this date.

Name: Eileen E
Title: not to be missed
Review: Wonderful site, best seen with a guide, since the Indian culture is so unique, an explanation is most useful.

Name: bubbles080
Title: museum
Review: well presented museum documenting all the past maharajahs of India with portraits and furniture where public audiences with ministers took place

Name: gourmetclub
Title: Wow, the way the royalty lived !!
Review: The City palace has the Deewane Aam open for most public viewing. However you can pay more and visit special areas. The open courtyard displayed the silver urns which were used to transport the holy water for the king to Britain were spectacular. The museum display was also intriguing and the main hall  with the portraits of the various kings was a little dull though systematic. The jewellery outlet within the premises  had a rich display. An in- fort cafe was nice though very expensive. A guide might be handy to bring in the local flavour.

Name: drn85
Title: Diwaan-e-aam architectural excellence...
Review: Diwaan-e-aam Hall of public audience is a part of the city palace located in jaipur. Everyone will visit this place on your trip to city palace. There is an entry fee for the city palace and students will get concession once you submit your identity cards. Credit cards are also accepted. The most important attractions nived there are the red thrones and the huge chandelier kept over there. We can click some nice pics over there. Except that there is not mucj yo explore in this area. Altogether it's a must visit place for the travellers in jaipur.

Name: jitendra g
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: It is very nice place to visit with friends and family as well. but don't expect to much with this place.

Name: Rumples
Title: Beautiful Hall
Review: This large hall -- part of Jaipur's City Palace Museum -- features two red thrones placed together; a huge, mostly red carpet; and a massive chandelier. Architectural details include double rows of marble columns and scalloped arches. The area is roped off, so we joined a long line of people who shuffled around it for a better look. No photography is allowed.Though I enjoyed looking at the space, I found the the walls around the edges to be more interesting. They featured miniature paintings and sculpture.We visited in the late afternoon on a weekday in December when most of the City Palace that is open to the public was crowded. There may be less visitors early in the morning or at other times of the year.

Name: ranjana c
Title: nice
Review: All part of Amber Fort. reaching the fort was very time consuming since the road was narrow and traffic hold ups occured despite being a one way street- the  parking at the fort seemed to be the problem. but the entire fort is very nice. Hearsay was that residents of Sirmaur, HP, get to get in free since the Rani is from Sirmaur, but that was not so!! Anyway  the gardens, the restoration work on the walls that was in progress was amazing.good excursion , all in all.

Name: jaiprakash1202
Title: Diwan-e-Aam (The royal feel)
Review: i was so happy to see this place as this looks exactly to watch was shown in the movie "Jodha Akbar". Its really giving the royal feels and proud moment of witnessing the greatness of our historical past.

Name: Baarish
Title: Impressive Hall
Review: This is the first structure one comes across as one enters the gate of amber palace.The pillars are restored but one can have a good idea of the beautiful original carvings by looking at the cornice of each pillar.

Name: Patricia D
Title: Part of Palace Museum
Review: Really a great place to soak in the local ambience. There was a cute puppet show with music, we saw snake charmers as we walked in. I found the palace public audience room beautiful with the silver throne chairs, carpets, chandeliers and wall pictures.

Name: Sankar Mukherjee
Title: Public meet
Review: a single storied building of deewan-e-aam in the courtyard of the city palace as you enter from the Sabha Griha, at the center of the courtyard, with a display of old guns in a beautiful way is framed. This place contains two container of silver(largest of the world) is displayed in glass box. Some mementos are sold here.

Name: Binu A
Title: Wait here for the king!!
Review: Diwan-i-Aam, the Hall of Public Audience, is a marble floored chamber located between the armory and the art gallery and is part of the City Palace.The main attraction here are two huge sterling silver vessels and they hold the Guinness World Record as the world's largest sterling silver vessels.This Hall along with others can be seen as part of the larger City Palace tour.

Name: Cruzz H
Title: Good Place
Review: Diwan-e-Am Hall of Public Audience is good place to see the king royalty even see th real life of a king in Diwane-e-Aam Hall. good place to visit tourist attraction even old history within

Name: Carol P
Title: An impressive hall with great portraits of former royalty
Review: Helpful to understand the lineage of Royalty and an impressive internal space.Well worth visiting the bookshop.

Name: Auldrin2016
Title: Historical palace
Review: Lots and lots to know about the kings and queens life about their culture and lifestyle. will give you history of the battles and victories

Name: Vishal V
Title: Part Jaigarh fort - has got much ore to see.
Review: This is a small part of Jaigarh Fort. The fort itself has too good parts to see. The open hall has some ancient machinery, exclusively meant to viewed here. Ever cared how to get cold breezes in hot weather?  they had there own hand made ACs - all mechanical, hand driven wooden machinery to cool down the rough weather in Rajisthan - I found Exclusive.

Name: YogRan
Title: Good place
Review: Situated inside the City palace.. very close from Hawa Mahal.. No guide required.. Nothing much to see

Name: Rockwell M
Title: So Fascinating
Review: this so nice to see the real feeling of those day where king and rulers and ministers you to sit down what they use to do. this is so real. Amazing

Name: Travelwisewoman
Title: Another beautiful Hall in the myriad of buildings comprising the City Palace!
Review: The Hall of Public Audience is yet another beautiful spot in the myriad of buildings which comprise the City Palace of Jaipur and the elaborate doorways and lovely pink walls are a must for another photo stop!

Name: LuizDutraNeto
Title: At the historical Hall of Public Audiences of the Maharajahs of Jaipur ...
Review: At this magnificent hall, the "Maharajahs of Jaipur" used to hold public meetings and gatherings. Today, "Diwan-e-Aam" is an art gallery. Enjoy its beautiful painted ceilings, its collections of Persian, Rajasthan and Mughal paintings, rare manuscripts, shawls and carpets. And, principally, the stunning "Golden Throne", the historical seat of the "Maharajahs of Jaipur"! Enjoy!

Name: Globetrottersince97
Title: All part and parcel of royalty
Review: Discrimination based on wealth. Common man given separate halls and rest a special hall. Not much worth it to be honest

Name: Travel Vibes - India
Title: The Sabha Niwas (Hall of Public Audience)
Review: The 'Hall of Public Audience' is a hall with the ceiling painted in rich red and gold colours. This chamber, functioning now as an art gallery, has exhibits of exquisite miniature paintings (of Rajastahni, Mughal and Persian art), ancient texts, embroidered rugs, Kashmir shawls and carpets. At present, it is an art gallery showcasing enthralling painted ceilings and rare ancient handwritten original manuscripts of Hindu scriptures (the Hindu holy scripture of the Bhagavad Gita handwritten in tiny script). Also seen in the art gallery is the Royal throne (called as Takth-e-Rawal) that was the seat of the Maharaja during public audience. It was mounted on an elephant or carried by palanquin bearers during the Maharajas visit outside the palace. At the entry gateway to the hall, two large elephants, each made out of single marble rock are on display.

Name: anjaliprabhu
Title: Part of City Palace
Review: This is part of the city palace which is huge. Take a guide along so that you can understand the historical importance.

Name: Ikbal V
Title: Very nice
Review: I visited Diwan e aam hall of Public audience in city palace with my family.  This very nice to see ..

Name: HudsonS16
Title: Great Gallery
Review: The carpets are 17thC and the workmanship is impressive. It must have taken ages to complete the whole carpet. Don't miss the early manuscripts & delicate books, the minature paintings and of course, the chandelier

Name: Manish B
Title: Excellent Building
Review: Diwan-e-Aam is inside at the city palace and its open for tourists to visit. Excellent building in the middle of City. You will love the place and see many great items of the royal family. highly recommended place to visit.

Name: Kashyap Dwivedi
Title: Lovely Architecture :-)
Review: This place is unique in itself & with mix architecture work by Mughals, Rajputs & Europeans makes it different.Maharaja use this place for public meetings where issues of society were discussed & taken care publicly.

Name: sargunarao
Title: Beautiful
Review: Diwan E-Aam Hall of public audience located in the city palace complex. The hall served as the place where the King address  the public. The hall known as Sabha Niwas among the local of Jaipur and made of Jiapur's signature architecture of pink sandstones.

Name: NIR006
Title: Great place for history lovers
Review: - Located inside the city place- The hall where the maharajas used to hold their assembly- Elaborate seating areas for maharajas, the queens, the ministers and the common people- Clean, neat and well-maintained

Name: EshwarSaba
Title: Nothing very kaas about the Diwan-e-Aam
Review: When one goes around historical locations in Delhi, Agra and Jaipur, two words that frequent at every location are Diwan-e-Aam, and Diwan-e-khas - where the first is place (in or around the palace), where the ruler met the general public, and the later is the place where the ruler met the special guests. The city palace at Jaipur also has a similar place.

Name: Kum_akh
Title: Histroci place
Review: maharaja used to meet the common man at this place. well connected to public transport.Diwan-e -Aam is a part of the city palace

Name: ddevarshi
Title: Also known as Sabha Niwas
Review: This is a part of City Palace of Maharaja Sawai Mansingh II Museum. It is a huge hall, where Maharaja used to meet people. There are carpets, paintings and furniture of olden times. You get to see life size paintings of rulers. LED display shows collection of some old photographs from this hall and other occasions of City Palace. Photography is not allowed in this gallery too.

Name: Cooltraveller3
Title: Amazed at the beauty of the palace
Review: Beautiful, magnificent structure. The silver jar which the maharaja used during his trip to London is one of the exhibits there. Also many Guns and swords adorn the walls.

Name: santanu
Title: Part of the City Palace
Review: Diwan-e -Aam is a part of the city palace. In past kings meets the common people here and addressed their problems.

Name: Rajendraraje
Title: A peep in the past
Review: Experience the royal glory first hand. Get a fair idea of how the royalty lived in the era gone by. The grandeur and the sheer aura of the place would floor anyone.

Name: bishwaksen
Title: Hall with Massive Jars
Review: The hall lies in the middle of the City Palace complex. There are a couple of big chandeliers. On both sides, there are decorations made with swords and guns. The undoubted attraction here are the two massive jars - reputed to be the biggest silver vessels in the world.

Name: priteshkulkarni
Title: Royal palace part
Review: Diwan e aam hall is a part of city palace. It is open hall where royal people used to meet common people of jaipur. Nice building with simple carving. place is maintained properly.

Name: MumbaiPradeep
Title: Part of City Palace
Review: This is part of the city palace where the king used to hold his Darbar. A bit of history can be read here.

Name: Naouel
Title: Diwan-e-Aam Hall of Public Audience
Review: Diwan-e-Aam is one of the parts of City Palace in Jaipur. This hall was the place where the Kings used to have their public meetings. The hall is majestic and huge.

Name: pkaran
Title: Great monument inside City Palace Jaipur
Review: Diwan e Aam is one of the parts of amazing City Palace in Jaipur. This is the place where kings used to have public gathering. Surrounded by pink walls, it is a big courtyard with a hall in the middle with 2 big silver jars and chandeliers.

Name: Dee-Passionate-Wanderer
Title: A big spacious hall
Review: Beautiful works of marble and open well ventilated hall. The kings used this place to conduct public meetings and to meet the aam aadmi.

Name: DrWJW
Title: Grand Hall
Review: The entrance to "Central Hall." This is one of the few "decorated" interiors.  You can only wonder how the materials withstand the heat and the humidity.  Be prepared to "tip" the guard if you want to take a picture.

Name: godspeed4476
Title: Average place
Review: Just a very average place inside the city palace complex, do not know why its mentioned as a separate landmark, you do not need to buy any tickets to see it (apart from the palace ticket)

Name: nitsj76
Title: Public Audience Hall at City Palace
Review: We visited the Diwan E Aam at Royal City Palace in Jaipur sometime back.The place with its red and pink coloured walls and field guns parked nearby, takes you back to the bygone dates of Rajput era. This hall was the place where the Kings used to have their public meetings with their subjects of their everday issues.The courtyard is pretty huge and can easily  accommodate hundreds of men. Closely is the hall for private audience which was reserved for the noblemen and royalty.Nice attraction when visiting the city palace in the Pink City

Name: Ankit250384
Title: Diwan- e-Aam Good place
Review: It is located in the city palace. this place is used by jaiour king to listen common people issued and request

Name: ASHISH SETHI
Title: The 'Diwan-E-Aam' (Sabha Niwas) or the 'Hall of Public Audience' is an enchanting chamber
Review: The works of art displayed on the walls include two remarkable large paintings on cloth depicting Lord Krishna celebrating Holi. This magnificent assembly hall was the throne room of the palace, designed for ceremonial assemblies involving the ruling Maharaja

Name: chetan1586
Title: Public Grievance zone
Review: Diwan-e-Aam is the part of city palace which was used as a public forum area in the royal era.The outer pillar are made of red stone which does not get heated even with sun rays while the inner pillars are made of marble.This is a must see place in city palace

Name: Prashant D
Title: Part of City Palace, for Public Gatherings
Review: This is a part of City Palace, and was meant for public gatherings. There are cannons kept outside and the overall view of the Hall is good.The walls inside the Hall are adorned with photographs of the royal lineage. It is also nicely decorated with carpets on the floor and nice paintings on the wall and ceiling.Worth stopping by to admire this portion during the tour of the City Palace.

Name: Vikshar
Title: Public place(during royal era) in City palace
Review: part of city palace and guide or audio guide will give details about it.Meant for general public gatherings

Name: Abhishek M
Title: Silver Vessels
Review: Must see huge silver cans place in center of hall, this was used by king to carry ganges water to london in 1902

Name: Lalchhanhima R
Title: must do in Jaipur
Review: now this is a must see in jaipur. Pictures of the all the previous kings of jaipur, the royal dress, chair and other monuments. The hall is majestic and huge

Name: Kaushal D
Title: Nice
Review: This place is in the City Palace.the interiors of this place is very beautiful. While touring the City palace you will visit this place.

Name: Himmat B
Title: Grand Hall
Review: A part of the City Palace, this is a grand open hall that exhibits great Architecture. If you visit the City Palace, it would take effort to miss this place.

Name: Charming_Karl
Title: The more museum-like section of the City Palace complex
Review: There are times when not being allowed to take photographs seems less an attempt to get you to buy their books full of photos, and more a matter of showing respect.  The latter is certainly the case here, although I must admit, I was really tempted to yank out my camera more than once.  What stopped me?  Well, our guide was a serious but kind person and I would've been embarrassed to do anything for which he might need to chide me.  Plus, there were plenty of other areas where we were welcome to take photos.As for this hall, we avoided the section that has been turned into a military museum and focused on the part devoted to the history of the royal family.  Lovely.

Name: KLE2013
Title: Magnificent Throne Room
Review: The former ceremonial hall now displays rare miniature Mughal paintings and larger than life portraits of the Maharajas of Jaipur.  Seeing these portraits made the history of the Palace come alive and the stories of the rulers more impactful.  The massive carpet that stretched the length of the hall was only partially displayed but the extravagant silver throne was fully visible.  Sadly Photography is not allowed in this part of City Palace Museum.

Name: raja p
Title: excellent
Review: i visited this place in 10feb2015.this is part of city palace.i like the place here.firangis the kings transport vehicles exhibited here.nice memory.

Name: Ravi Kishore
Title: heritage at its best
Review: very well maintained even though made into a hall of exhibits. can't take photos here but you'll admire the architecture and heritage of the place.

Name: M C
Title: Glimpse of History
Review: The hall is part of the city palace, and the design was changed slightly to make the exhibition, but not a major change.The items exhibited are well maintained compared to such period.

Name: Ashish Singla
Title: Speechless
Review: I am speechless to describe about this place. The meeting hall of the royal family is very well maintained. Photography is not allowed at this place. One can feel a real royal experience here. This is situated inside the City Palace in Jaipur.

Name: itspriyanka
Title: Excellent
Review: Its located inside the City Palace, one of the grandest places in Jaipur. Loved the architecture. Must visit.

Name: murali8121
Title: Diwan e aam at city palace
Review: Its part of the city palace complex in Jaipur and as in any other part of the palace, the work has been fantastic. A place where the king used to meet the public to address their grievances. The place where the king used to sit along with appointed places for the ministers, the other nobles are all very interesting to see.

Name: PrestonGuild
Title: Audience in the city
Review: Mubarak Mahal was built by Maharaja Madho Singh. Contained within it is the Diwan-e-Khas (the Hall of private audience) and Diwan-e-Aam (the hall of public audience). The Hall of the public audience as the name implies were members of the public would arrive with petitions and grievances and seek audience to the King and his ministers. However for more exquisite halls, look at the Amber Fort.
